Package data

Class Database

java.lang.Object
data.Database
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Database extends Object implements Serializable
Stores all data used.
Since:
2022-10-30
Version:
5.0
Author:
Guo Sihan, Davyn Yam JunHao, Wang Yu Teng, Aditya Pugalia, Ng Yong Jian

      Database(ArrayList<Cineplex> cineplexes, MovieListing movieListing, ShowListing showListing, BookingSystem bookingSystem, ArrayList<MovieGoer> movieGoers, ArrayList<Staff> staffs)
      Construct a new database with the following parameters:
      Parameters:
      cineplexes - An ArrayList of Cineplexes.
      movieListing - An ArrayList of Movies.
      showListing - An ArrayList of Shows.
      bookingSystem - The Booking System.
      movieGoers - An ArrayList of Movie Goers.
      staffs - An ArrayList of Staff members.

    • getCineplex

      public Cineplex getCineplex(String cineplexName)
      A function to check whether a target cineplex is already in the database.
      Parameters:
      cineplexName - The name of the cineplex.
      Returns:
      The cineplex if found, else null.

    • getMovieGoer

      public MovieGoer getMovieGoer(String userEmail)
      A function to get fetch the movie goer from the database using user email.
      Parameters:
      userEmail - The user's email.
      Returns:
      The target Movie Goer.

      A function to fetch a staff member from the database using their email.

      Returns:
      The staff member.
